website_summaries.verdict: A bible of sorts for the culinary-focused vegan. A bestseller that’s a staple in many plant-based kitchens.
pros: Affordable for cooks on a budget
Most of the recipes have easy-to-source ingredients
Many dishes include grains and legumes
cons: Some of the recipes require extra steps that lengthen prep and cook time

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I am plant based in my food choices but this cookbook was a disappointment. I’m not interested in recipes that call for so many ingredients and sauces, dressings, and concoctions that have to be made before you can complete it. Simple is way better and these recipes are far from simple.
customer_reviews.author: sassysheila

customer_reviews.title: Same recipes over and over with slight variations
customer_reviews.text: Might as well title this 300 recipes for quinoa. I mean I like quinoa, but geez, the recipes continue to repeat themselves with slightly different versions of the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: KTM

customer_reviews.title: Careful if you are an autoimmune eater. I am ...
customer_reviews.text: Careful if you are an autoimmune eater. I am allergic to nightshades and coconut and this book had the majority of the recipes with these two ingredients. Also, a very long ingredients list for most things. If you are busy look for healthy meals that take under 20 minutes to prepare, this is not the book for you!
customer_reviews.author: T'keyah Vaughan

customer_reviews.title: This is a must read for those of you who have always failed at losing weight or just want a better health profile
customer_reviews.text: I've followed the recipes in this book/plan very closely for over 12 weeks now and I've lost 47 lbs. This is a must read for those of you who have always failed at losing weight or just want a better health profile. You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Thomas Ward

customer_reviews.title: The Author likes spicy food.
customer_reviews.text: I really like the vast majority of recipes available in this book. Some are really complicated to make. I have noticed that most of the recipes I come across are geared for those with a taste for really spicy food. This works for me because I like spicy food. Many of the recipes do call for some very expensive ingredients, even if you are a really thrifty shopper.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob R. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Just what I wanted
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a plant based recipe book that could show me all the various ways plants can be used. Also I love oil, but I wanted to try oil-free, sugar-free cooking. To my delight, the recipes are so tasty. I love to cook, so exploring this cookbook is like a fun adventure for me. Some of the ingredients were not in my local grocery store, but I found them in my local organic grocery store or here on Amazon. It’s such fun and I have enjoyed all the food and this plant-based lifestyle so far.
customer_reviews.author: RocWithYou

customer_reviews.title: I'm getting ready to throw this big bowl of food away because even my non picky eater didn't like it.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this cookbook. I cooked a few of the meals for my family. Thumbs down is what I got every time. So many leftovers got thrown away because no one wants to eat it again. Not to mention the amount of work that went forth just to make the dish. It is not very practical. Especially for a family of 4 kids and 2 adults.
customer_reviews.author: Candace mom of 4

customer_reviews.title: Finally, a Plant Based Cookbook with Good Tasting Food
customer_reviews.text: I'm not much of a cook, but after seeing the documentary I knew I wanted to eat a more plant based diet. Using this cookbook and a pressure cooker I learned how to make delicious, healthy, meals. In one long weekend I felt like a pro. These recipes use easy to find ingredients, and encourage the fresh versions, have clearly written directions, and most importantly the food is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Look elsewhere for a vegan cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book based on all of the positive reviews. I should have read the negative ones because those were definitely spot on. I tried several of the recipes in this book and they were ALL DISGUSTING. I am not an amateur in the kitchen and I was unable to salvage any of them. Time, money and energy straight out the window every time. And forget the pictures! The meals come out looking nothing like them. I am turned off by veganism and my tastebuds are traumatized.
customer_reviews.author: stephen pineda

customer_reviews.title: No nutritional information.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this cookbook because the print in very small, the photos are all located in the center of the book not beside each recipe and worst of all, there is NO nutritional information about each recipe. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Schreck

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: I like this cook book but it’s not what I was expecting. There’s a lot of recipes in it but only like 20 pictures in the middle of the book. It has a lot of recipes that call for another recipie from the book and i wanted something a little more simple for a newly vegan. The recipies in the pictures look yummy then ones with out pictures I’m not sure lol because I would like to see what I’m making.
customer_reviews.author: tim henderson

customer_reviews.title: So good!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered several vegan cookbooks at the same time. I was very excited when they all came in, and I tried recipes from each of them. I was a little disappointed at the lack of pictures in this particular book. So upon delivery, it was my least favorite. However, after trying a recipe, I was surprised at how delicious it was. Better than the recipes of the other, more colorful recipe books I ordered. So, I continued to try more recipes out of this book. So far, every recipe that I’ve tried has turned out wonderful. This is my new favorite cookbook. I was very pleasantly surprised with the numerous high-quality recipes. I definitely recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Kathrina A.

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried about 15 recipes from this book... Can't recall any that I liked enough to remake. Half of them ended up straight in the garbage can... Very depressing cookbook. I also have the How Not To Die Cookbook, and can say that it's much better than the FOK Cookbook, for sure!!
customer_reviews.author: Nevin

customer_reviews.title: No photos accompany recipes
customer_reviews.text: I don't like cookbooks that do not provide photos of what the recipe is supposed to look like for at least most of the recipes presented. It's a matter of motivation and a check on if what I made came out halfway correct. This cookbook has none alongside the recipes and only a few bunched together toward the middle. I also found the recipes overall to be pretty boring and somewhat repetitive. I've found more interesting vegan recipes online.
customer_reviews.author: Mimi

customer_reviews.title: Another cookbook that forgets that we eat with our eyes first
customer_reviews.text: Why in this day and age of Instagram are publishers still producing cookbooks without full color photos for each dish!? We eat with our eyes first. I get why the joy of cooking is all black and white and zero pictures but when it’s missing from a modern cookbook it just feels lazy. Also, the paper... why is this not a satin paper!? I wouldn’t buy this book again because it does NOT get me excited about vegan cooking. Giving it 3 stars because it promotes plant based eating but the book itself (as a cookbook) is trash.
customer_reviews.author: L. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful assortment of great recipes!
customer_reviews.text: 'Forks Over Knives' cook book provides a wonderful variety of recipes and ideas to make delicious food. Even if you are not totally vegan, you can use this cook book to add many yummy plant-based dishes to your diet. Well thought out, with great details and pictures, there are so many excellent recipes here! I love the pesto, tofu sour cream, and cauliflower Bechamel! Great cooks use recipes as a base, and then add items or subtract according to taste. You can make original food every day for a year with this book. ENJOY!
customer_reviews.author: PiGirl

customer_reviews.title: Great book. Plus the meals are really fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great book. Plus the meals are really fantastic. However, I do admit, I do add a little avocado oil when I saute because even no stick pans stick. I am eating so healthy, that a teaspoon of oil in the dish won't hurt anything. Just my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Wagner

customer_reviews.title: The most important of all information: missing!
customer_reviews.text: This is based on a great documentary. Unfortunately for me, it was somewhat of a letdown. Meals are too complicated and don't follow the strict dietary guidelines that the two doctors endorsed. But what I found extremely irritating to the point of not using the book, is the omission of nutritional information for each recipe. For a cook book like this that is mandatory. I want to know what nutrients and how much of each. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Shamus Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Recipes not tasty
customer_reviews.text: Don’t buy this one or the Forks over Knives Planner. Too many ingredients and some of those ingredients are hard to find. The author raved about their Sweet Potato Mac and Cheese and after a couple of bites, my husband and I decided to feed the rest of it to our garbage disposal....what a waste of time. This was our first introduction to the plant based diet after watching two documentaries, but these cookbooks did not wow us. We’re still following a plant based diet, but not using these tasteless recipes. Sorry
customer_reviews.author: Wendyk627

customer_reviews.title: One of the best
customer_reviews.text: This is full of delicious and healthy recipes. One of the best out there. Try the app as well which is constantly updated with new recipes!
customer_reviews.author: RiderRalph

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I recommend FOK the film as an introduction for my patients who are new to trying to do everything "right" for their health. I would love to be able to recommend this cookbook, but as a pretty good home cook, I just can't. For someone who is new to this way of eating and cooking, these recipes would fall flat. While the basic ideas are usually solid, they typically require some tweaking that requires prior experience. I have yet to make anything from this that was satisfactorily tasty as written.
customer_reviews.author: AnonMD

customer_reviews.title: Honestly I returned the Cookbook. The recipes from this ...
customer_reviews.text: Honestly I returned the Cookbook. The recipes from this book is NASTY. I made the No Cheese Sauce and it stunk up my whole RV. Hours later when my husband came home, he asked me what is that awful smell......I used FRESH everything...
customer_reviews.author: Jdavis2012

customer_reviews.title: Needs More Pictures
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure that the recipes are fabulous! I've used some FOK ones from online, however I like to have a real book, so I ordered this. I was a bit disappointed of the lack of pictures. I'm less apt to make a dish without seeing it first.
customer_reviews.author: LBY

customer_reviews.title: WHOLE FOODS PLANT BASED DIET
customer_reviews.text: Forks Over Knives made it so easy to understand how the Standard American Diet (SAD) affected my health and the health of all Americans. This cookbook made it so easy to make the change without feeling deprived and while enjoying delicious food. I am so grateful I made the change! Looking forward to long, happy and healthy life!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Melissa

customer_reviews.title: It's a great cookbook, but...
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook is packed full is recipes, the only problem? I think a lot in here are not easy nor time saving. I got 2 books at the same time and the other cook book is far better. I do really like the breakfast smoothies in this book, but I have an extremely small kitchen and most the prep time is just too much in this book. It leans towards casseroles and Asian dishes that are not very appealing to me. I give it four stars because it maybe just what some other vegan/Vegetarian likes, but it's not for me. I enjoy from plant to plate much more.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer H

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: An excellent cookbook for those trying to transition to Plant Based cooking. Interesting and easy recipes.
customer_reviews.author: G. Metro

customer_reviews.title: Delicious recipes
customer_reviews.text: I have made several recipes from this book & every one was delicious. My husband and I are slowly easing in vegetarian dishes, and this book really helps. On the negative side, some of the ingredients are a little difficult to find in regular grocery stores, therefore, I have had to find some specialty stores. The picture recipe is the Lentil Soup with Cauliflower, Potatoes & Spinach.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Kozminski

customer_reviews.title: Average quality book with decent recipes
customer_reviews.text: The book is made with good quality paper, and a good binding There is a group of recipe pictures in the center of the book, but I'd rather see pictures for a recipe on or near the same page. Where pictures are located close to recipes, they are not in color. Over-all a good book with good recipes for the price, but I'd pay more for a better quality book with more pictures.
customer_reviews.author: DreadPirateWestley

customer_reviews.title: Extreme
customer_reviews.text: I have been collecting cookbooks my whole life. I hoped this one would give me ideas on what to make when I want a meatless meal. However, most of the recipes are so extremely low fat that they have the most bland flavors. In fact one needs fat for absorption of many spices like turmeric! I can understand someone who has colon or stomach cancer using these recipes for healing but not for every day.
customer_reviews.author: Shelley S. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good - not great - but still worth the $$
customer_reviews.text: Some great material from our friends at FoK, who I have such admiration for - particularly because of the difficulty of their task: trying to talk people out of their beloved meat/dairy/oil-based diets. Many many useful recipes in this book are worth twice the price (e.g. the soups/chilis are great). Some of these recipes are almost unforgivably bad, e.g. one almost needs to adopt the suspension of disbelief to pretend the hummus recipes here are any good. You simply cannot make good hummus without a bit of tahini. And the pesto tofu recipe is so comically terrible that I found myself laughing at how bad it was. Such is the lot of the newbie to plant-based, no oil cooking.
customer_reviews.author: David in Sacramento

customer_reviews.title: Veggies are good for everyone
customer_reviews.text: Just started to cut red meat out of my diet. I needed ideas for cooking and preparing meals. The documentary that this cookbook is based from is very good, Forks over Knives. I wish the pictures of the dishes were placed with the actual recipes. All the pictures are in the middle of the book.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleD

customer_reviews.title: Adequate
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad vegetarian cookbook if you are a beginner, but I would recommend The Oh she glows...instead if you are just buying one. It had more recipes that I found I was likely to try.
customer_reviews.author: Rimbaud

customer_reviews.title: plant based cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this after enjoying several online sources of the Fork over Knives organization. I had tried some recipes and enjoyed them. I liked the first section where various sauces and base ingredient recipes were. I was disappointed in the recipe selections of the cookbook. I had expected some nice brunch breakfast ideas. The recipes just felt uninspired. There is a vegetable fajita recipe that quite frankly was disappointing.This just was not what I was looking for in the variety of recipes. It does come with a nice spiral design.
customer_reviews.author: carol gerling

customer_reviews.title: Veggies like you've never known them!
customer_reviews.text: This is my new favorite cookbook! It's helping me explore new ways to enjoy vegetables and maintain a more balanced whole-foods focused diet. I don't strictly do the vegan thing, but this cookbook is really broadening my view of vegetables and helped me learn to make them taste delicious. I've especially enjoyed the granola and pumpkin bread recipes, as well as a couple of the veggie stews. I'm looking forward to trying the cookies and some of the creative whole-foods plant-baded take on some traditional ethnic dishes.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Rankin

customer_reviews.title: Imaginative and practical plant-based cookbook
customer_reviews.text: Forks Over Knives is beautifully laid out and presents a large number of recipes you probably never thought of. Now you can try something new. Directions for the recipes are simple and adequate. But, I hate the page numbers placed on the side of each page. Hey, designer, this is a really bad idea. Don't ever fo it again. Whatever, this is a book you will use. How about curried squash and apple soup?
customer_reviews.author: Max Lubach

customer_reviews.title: A good vegan introduction!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly comprehensive introduction to veganism and a succinct explanation of why a person would choose such a lifestyle to begin with. The book contains many basic recipes you need to get started, and all the recipes in the collection contain accessible ingredients and clear, readily understood directions. An interesting find that will make you want to read the companion book!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Great cookbook except for the missing pages
customer_reviews.text: We loved the film, so we were excited to try some of the recipes from this book. The only complaint is there are some pages missing (in the dessert section), which is probably for the best! : )
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm a vegan and wanted to like this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: None of the hundreds of recipes in this book seemed easy or interesting. Many were very similar. I have to say that I have not tried any of them. I go online to some great sites and find recipes that are easier to make with more common ingredients. There are much better vegan cookbooks out there now. I can see now why this one is so heavily discounted.
customer_reviews.author: Swan Girl

customer_reviews.title: Defective print on two order
customer_reviews.text: First time around pages were duplicated and some missing, Second book has ink stain in many pages. I kept it anyway. I would recommend buying the app instead of the book.
customer_reviews.author: AMB

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes, if you like plant-based foods
customer_reviews.text: As far as this recipe book is concerned, it’s well written and has a vast amount of recipes. However, I tried the plant-based diet for 2 months. I was completely burned out on beans, veggies, and god knows what other stuff I was eating. I am back to moderation. Seems to keep me happy!
customer_reviews.author: Roger W Sonsini

customer_reviews.title: So delicious!
customer_reviews.text: My family is trying to be more plant based. And I love my instant pot so this cookbook seemed ideal. I find a lot of vegan recipes to taste bland, lacking in richness. However, every recipe I tried from this book were flavorful, complex and satisfying. My pickiest easter even loved the Mac-n-cheese. The cheese sauce is amazing! The recipes each have multiple ingredients and spices that add layers of flavor and complexity. I want to make every recipe!
customer_reviews.author: Nansi

customer_reviews.title: TYPE 2 DIABETICS BEWARE! You need to check after-meal (PP), glucose levels, especially 1 hour  Excellent vegan diet for others.
customer_reviews.text: No nutritional breakdown for the recipes. This high carb diet sends my glucose levels spiking even though whole grain and high fiber, and I have had my prediabetes under control for almost 20 years with no meds. This pushes me into diabetic level. Carb level per serving would help solve that problem. Many see glucose levels fall due to losing weight.
customer_reviews.author: Henrietta Lala

customer_reviews.title: Good recipes, not enough pictures, no nutritional info
customer_reviews.text: This cookbook left a lot of white space on the page leaving plenty of room for a whole lot more photos. Some, not even close to all photos were in aseparate section of the book. When you're going to cook something a little out of the ordinary, a picture is necessary. likewise I also appreciate when nutritional information is included and this does not.
customer_reviews.author: GSP and Dane Lady

customer_reviews.title: Great resource
customer_reviews.text: Forks Over Knives (FOK) is a great cookbook with more than 300 receipts, which are easy to make and taste great, and is based upon Forks Over Knives whole food, plant based eating recommendations for healthy eating, improved health, safe weight loss, eat more and weigh less, and reversing major diseases, such as, diabetes, hypertension, and other diet related diseases. For more information about FOK, go online to website forksoverknives.com
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Lewis-Wells

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for healthy eating newbies
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my professor who recently went vegan. She LOVED how many recipes they were, how clear they were to follow, and the variety of things she could now cook! I have used the book myself, and it’s great. It is easy to tweet recipes to to make spicier or sweeter or however you prefer
customer_reviews.author: Lexi

customer_reviews.title: No more salads everyday
customer_reviews.text: Love this book for ideas to broaden my dishes I already make. It has everything from breakfast, lunch, dinner, soups, stews, dressings/sauces, stocks, desserts, salads, stuffed and baked vegetables, bean dishes, dishes with grains and casseroles. It really does help to expand the mind of a new vegan and explore different food combinations to make plant based doable and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Starkiss22

customer_reviews.title: Good but not easy
customer_reviews.text: I love the recipes but maintaining the condiments, etc. is a challenge. There is a sameness to many of the dishes so it is hard to not feel like you're eating the same dish a lot. But if you cull through this and pick out your favorites, you will find some tasty dishes. The book is broken down into breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, etc. and has a lot of good advice and tips.
customer_reviews.author: G. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: I recently started eating a plant based diet. I saw the documentary and thought I would try the cookbook. I’m really happy I did this book is amazing. There’s a lot of great information and great recipes even for staples, so I can limit buying premade and processed ingredients in the stores. Even if you’re not looking to go fully plant based, this is a really great book to have to add healthy meals into your lifestyle.
customer_reviews.author: ABC

customer_reviews.title: LETS MAKE A CHANGE
customer_reviews.text: PLEASE DO YOUR PART TO STOP THE NEEDLESS SUFFERING AND KILLING OF ANIMALS! I have been vegan for 7 months now and my only regret is not understanding sooner. This book will help you greatly! It's helped me. "Your fate is on your plate." WE CAN ALL MAKE A CHANGE!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Overall a great source of recipes, but I do find I have a to tweak the seasonings quite a bit to avoid adding salt.
customer_reviews.author: Regina

customer_reviews.title: I’m still looking for a good vegan cookbook
customer_reviews.text: I missed all the other forks over knives products, so all I have is this cookbook. As a cookbook it’s not very good. Poorly organized, and not enough recipes. And it just seemed a little out of date.
customer_reviews.author: Richmond Delorme

customer_reviews.title: I returned this. The recipes are not only plant ...
customer_reviews.text: I returned this. The recipes are not only plant based but fat free. No oils, you saute with water, and guacamole recipe with no avocado (too much fat). I'm just not into this restrictive of a diet. I was hoping for some creative vegan recipes but this is a diet book.
customer_reviews.author: SC Reader

customer_reviews.title: Bland recipes, just not that good of a cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my least favorite plant based recipes even though I love Forks over Knives recipes off their website and in their Facebook group. I've made about a dozen things and nothing was standout or added to my regular rotation. Not good use of spices and, well, the recipes just aren't that good. There is good information about plant based eating. I don't recommend the purchase but it was the first WFPB cookbook I purchased and I did get a bit of useful info from it but it was nothing new.
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: The recipes don't look appealing
customer_reviews.text: I guess it's okay. Not my favorite cookbook. I'd go broke buying all the ingredients in there. Why not think about what people typically available and craft recipey around that? Most people eat two to three meals. You're sending us shopping for exotic ingredients for pretty much every meal. Quite honestly I'd send this book back.
customer_reviews.author: Jostaman

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver - both for your heart and your tastebuds!
customer_reviews.text: I was less than thrilled to be having to adapt to a yet more restrictive diet, but this cookbook changed my mind! The recioes are wonderful, and even my husband is eating them willingly. I'm so pleased with this purchase. I know I'll be using this cookbook a lot. In an added note to those who have heart failure and have to learn to live without salt in their diets and who are restricting even olive oil: get some good flavored vinegars! They give such a flavor boost to veggies, and for me, they really helped with those first weeks of weaning myself off of all salt and oil.
customer_reviews.author: Willca

customer_reviews.title: Best book to feed your self and soul
customer_reviews.text: After watching the documentary, I purchased this cookbook to get started as a newly minted vegan. So worth it! It’s not about PETA, it’s not about baby animals, it’s about you and your body health and the statistics surrounding the elimination of animal products supporting reduced inflammation, reducing and eliminating some cancers. The recipes are not overly complicated and sooo tasty! Loving this.
customer_reviews.author: Issaquah-Alli

customer_reviews.title: SO GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: SO GREAT!!! I love the Fork Over Knives books and movies. The information is priceless and the food is amazing. I wish more people would know about this and spread the word. The recipes range from super easy to medium easy. I don't see anything too hard to make. And it's all good for you. Try it!
customer_reviews.author: mediagirl

customer_reviews.title: Bizarre substitutions
customer_reviews.text: Strange, hard-to-find substitutions. For instance "unsweetened apple cider" and "brown rice syrup" in a recipe that normally calls for orange juice and corn syrup.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: Eh .. it's ok but not worth the price
customer_reviews.text: This book is great for individuals looking to start a plant centered diet. It has good ideas and starter recipes to ease into this lifestyle. I gave this book 3 stars for personal reasons- its recipes are very basic and somewhat insulting to foods that it attempts to mimic (moussaka is an example). As someone who cooks like this on a regular basis and eats less meat already- there were few recipes that I actually would utilize from this book.
customer_reviews.author: Hbs

customer_reviews.title: Did they even test these recipes?
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could say that this is a great cookbook. But I can't. I'm not even sure I would call it a good cookbook after trying several recipes, only to toss them in the trash. I have come to wonder if any of these were even kitchen tested. So far I've had better luck searching the internet.
customer_reviews.author: S. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Great book, arrived in bad condition
customer_reviews.text: Bummed, not about the content of the book, but it arrived with a creased cover and inside pages... does that really matter in the sense of the material, no, but it does “bend me outta shape”... stupid puns...
customer_reviews.author: jordan wall

customer_reviews.title: Good try, but recipes often need adjustments.
customer_reviews.text: I find that I have to really look at the recipes before I make them because some of the steps are just unrealistic. How to you get butternut squash fork tender by cooking it in a skillet over med heat for 5-6 minutes? Also, I generally double up on garlic, if called for, and increase spices quite a bit, as many dishes have come out bland. BUT, I like the concept, and am really trying to incorporate raw and whole foods into our diets. This book at least gives you many starting points for meals that are generally satiating and healthy.
customer_reviews.author: P. Trussell

customer_reviews.title: Healthy recipes but a little bland
customer_reviews.text: Some of the recipes are a little bland. Most don't tell you to add any salt. I wish they would put a suggested amount of salt and then comment that it's optional for those avoiding salt or on a low sodium diet. Whenever I cook for someone I have to hand them salt and pepper because they're almost always going to need it. I don't consume a lot of salt and I eat very healthy but everyone that has tried some of these meals agreed they need a little something - usually salt.
customer_reviews.author: VS RN

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Nice photos, easy to follow recipes. Some recipes are too long, and I did not/would not spend the time to do them. However, if you are a 'foodie' and like variety, there is plenty in here!
customer_reviews.author: R. Morlock

customer_reviews.title: Very useful cookbook.
customer_reviews.text: I have personally prepared at least 50 meals from this book. Most of the meals we have tried have been relatively inexpensive and quite good. We have been accustomed to this type of eating for a few years now, but a person just making a change to this type of eating may struggle adjusting to some of the meals. My reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that some of the ingredients are not available at normal grocery stores. This may not be a problem for a lot of people, I just don't have time to go around to multiple places to find unique foods.
customer_reviews.author: Brent O.

customer_reviews.title: The book came very quickly and in good condition. The book itself far exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: The book came very quickly and in good condition. The book itself far exceeded my expectations. I have looked at other vegetarian type books, but this one is full of tasty recipes and easy to find ingredients. I have made several meals with it and I'm very satisfied. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Carolynn Scott

customer_reviews.title: Useful, relatable recipes
customer_reviews.text: Recipes designed for families, so I've downsized many of them into 2-4 servings. There's useful information here, but basically, if you know how to cook at all, it's possible to just re-think your existing recipes to eliminate animal products and substitute other proteins while still keeping taste. In my experience, if food tastes good and is nutritious, it's possible to eat well and be healthy. The book is useful in learning what kind of substitutions will work.
customer_reviews.author: jdayton

customer_reviews.title: Delicious and easy recipes
customer_reviews.text: I have made about five recipes from this cookbook so far. Each have been scrumptious! Of course, I choose the recipes that I think we would like. The ingredients are every day things; nothing exotic. Even my husband, who is not a vegan/vegetarian is enjoying the food that I prepare. This is now my go-to cookbook for food preparation. I highly recommend this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Forks OVER Knives Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: We have switched to a plant based diet due to my husband’s diabetes. It’s fantastic, and his blood sugar levels are going down, down, down! He is gradually taking less and less insulin and will soon be off of it. His endocrinologist is AMAZED! Highly recommended this cook book, and watch the movie on Netflix with the same name.
customer_reviews.author: Krystine Dove

customer_reviews.title: We love this cookbook
customer_reviews.text: A lot of great recipes. We recently went vegan looking for a whole food plant based diet. This book has some great ideas for combinations, it's well presented with lots of pictures and easy to follow..
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS ONE OCCASION IN WHICH THE MOVIE IS BETTER THAN THE BOOK
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS ONE OCCASION IN WHICH THE MOVIE IS BETTER THAN THE BOOK!!! PLEASE WATCH IT!! The book is pretty good for recipes but it basically is just a summary of the movie. The movie, on the other hand, was totally mind blowing! If you are relatively healthy, you may be able to lower the amount of processed foods & animal products that you eat a little at a time, but I'm telling you you will feel the difference. Eat things as close to their natural state as possible. Eating this way is definitely challenging & you need to learn to cook a whole new way with new ingredients but you can really come up with some yummy stuff!
customer_reviews.author: Natural Minded Family

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive -- good stuff
customer_reviews.text: This is a full-bodied compendium of whole-foods, plant-based recipes -- lowfat and low-sugar. It'll show you how to make a variety of tasty foods in keeping with what's recommended in,, and T. Colin Campbell's two books,, and. That's no small thing. One of the book's greatest strengths is the volume of recipes -- over 300. But the quality is uneven. I've made excellent things, and so-so, and in-between from this book.
customer_reviews.author: GskFn

customer_reviews.title: Good cook book, not enough photos
customer_reviews.text: I like this cookbook. The recipes are quick, delicious with ingredients that are easy to find at the store. The only problem....just not enough photos. Still a keeper, compliments my plant based library of cook books.
customer_reviews.author: Ann

customer_reviews.title: otherwise the recipes are good and there is a ton to choose
customer_reviews.text: there are A LOT of recipes where in order to make a certain recipe, you need to have already made one or two OTHER recipes to put into the one you are wanting to make. that is too much work!!! otherwise the recipes are good and there is a ton to choose from
customer_reviews.author: Josh L.

customer_reviews.title: Love this cookbook!
customer_reviews.text: I love everything Forks over Knives related so it isn't a shock how much I love this cookbook. The recipes are wonderful, delicious and easy to make!
customer_reviews.author: emily

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Vegan Cookbook
customer_reviews.text: This was an excellent vegan cookbook! I am new to the vegan/vegetarian diet and this cookbook has easy to follow recipes. I also love that this cookbook has a lot recipes in it that I actually want to eat. Looking forward to trying all of these recipes in this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: Lacie Megan Fitts

customer_reviews.title: Half of the recipes I've tried are good and half suck!!
customer_reviews.text: The ponzu pasta and cauliflower sauce on portabello are awesome! But the granola and smoothie sucked. The Indian dish Chana saag was ok.. 3 stars Also, when you specify kale in a recipe be sure to tell me what type of kale?!? And the date and kale smoothie was disgusting! Was I supposed to soak the dates? Use a specific type of kale?? When you say frozen berries what type of berries??
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: This book may save your life!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the most comprehensive study of nutrition ever conducted--The China Study--I was ready to re-examine my diet and replacing meat with plant-based foods. Forks Over Knives does just that It doesn't waste any time going over all the research, it just describes how to make basic recipes and use them in other recipes for breakfasts, salads, soups, vegetables, beans, grains, casseroles and desserts. All your protein needs are provided in this cookbook and you don't need a knife to cut any meat. This book is not only for weight loss and cardiovascular patients but is an excellent guide to saving money as food prices soar at the grocery.
customer_reviews.author: D. E. Cheney

customer_reviews.title: A Must Try
customer_reviews.text: The best 16 months ago started 2 years ago my cholesterol was in the 460 and my ldl at 260 like a ticking bomb. Today is normal at 106 and normal lipid ratio. Why can all just try it. Buy the book live ,inter feel younger and look slimmer because you are.
customer_reviews.author: Ana Lewellen

customer_reviews.title: It works if you work it.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been eating Whole Foods plant based for about 5 months now. I’ve lost almost 40lbs. This book has a lot of really great, easy to follow recipes. It takes a little getting used to with the different methods of cooking but once you get going it will become second nature.
customer_reviews.author: vawoodsman

customer_reviews.title: Beginners dream to Vegetarian Cooking
customer_reviews.text: I love that this book give you easy to make recipes with pictures. Now I know what it is supposed to look like. The recipes are easy to follow and taste amazing. The ingredients are readily available so it makes cooking easy and fun.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa L. Ell

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I see why so many people have loved this cookbook. It is fantastic. I joke that the only way I will now eat asparagus is in the Cream of Asparagus soup. We have tried multiple recipes from the book and they are all great so far.
customer_reviews.author: SomeoneLovesBooks

customer_reviews.title: Packed Book With Great Recipes, Just Watch the Spice
customer_reviews.text: There are quite a few recipes that I would deem extremely good here. That said, my wife is pickier than I and she still flagged a TON in here. I tend to deviate from the recipes a bit, but that's how I cook. Always looking to improve without adding calories, of course. The major critique I have for this book would be to watch the spice level. If you don't love spicy things, greatly reduce the red pepper flakes, etc used in the spicy recipes. It'll save you from making something you won't eat because it's too spicy.
customer_reviews.author: JamesFromFL

customer_reviews.title: Fairly easy recipes. So far everything i made taste better ...
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy recipes. So far everything i made taste better then expected. Fun and exciting new diet trying to go plant based. I'll see how my body reacts to it. I've been a carnivore for about 40 yrs now
customer_reviews.author: Zach Dow

customer_reviews.title: New vegetarian
customer_reviews.text: So a friend of mine suggested I try going vegetarian because of the success he has. This book was recommended to me by him. I came in mint condition and I am excited to try these recipes to see if going vegetarian is for me.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki H.

customer_reviews.title: Hardly worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I eat the Prevent and Reverse Heart Disease diet and had high hopes this would help improve the taste of the food. I am highly disappointed in this book. The only thing I got out of it was a good mayonnaise and sour cream recipe and a number of sauces. But most of the recipes are rather bland. UP date Aug 16,2015 Changing my feed back to 4 star we started finding a few recipies that are worth having.
customer_reviews.author: Old Timer

customer_reviews.title: Great Christmas gift
customer_reviews.text: I love the beginning of the book because it explains ways to prepare and to cook many different beans. I have only cooked canned beans, in the past, but I look forward to the bean recipes in this book. I bought several to give out at Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Montpetit

customer_reviews.title: Great recipes with plenty of room for adaptation
customer_reviews.text: I am a grain-free ovolactovegetarian moving gradually toward veganism. The recipes are great, use simple ingredients, and are very helpful to me in making the transition. Although there are many recipes that use grains, I am able to adapt them to my needs. Since I have been using mostly almond meal and almond flour in baking, these recipes give me more flexibility and they are visually far more appealing than the standard brown goop I seem to end up with when I use nut flours. The smoothie recipes are particularly good.
customer_reviews.author: Anne

customer_reviews.title: Great book I had to get one for myself
customer_reviews.text: A year or two back I bought this for my mom and she loved it. Since moving out okay had to get my own copy and I recommend this book! With cost effective recipes that are also healthy this book is incredible.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: The book that this is based on (The China Study) seems to provide the best and most reasonably researched information on diet an
customer_reviews.text: I am a RN with genetic high LDL and I cannot take statins. I read all the studies out there on diet and heart health. The book that this is based on (The China Study) seems to provide the best and most reasonably researched information on diet and health. However, a word of caution, going to a plant based diet can cause certain mineral and vitamin deficiencies if the diet is not followed correctly. The recipes are tasty and instructions clear. Give it a whirl and watch your health improve!
customer_reviews.author: Love Life

customer_reviews.title: Fun to read, excellent so far to use.
customer_reviews.text: Almost every page has a delightful surprise. The recipes in this book are creative, and so far, delicious. I'm still not finished with my first read-thru; tabbing pages that have recipes I want to try make this book look like I've had it for years! And on the very plus side, it's all good for you! I just wish it had more pictures, but that is not that big a deal.
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: most of these are not in stores
customer_reviews.text: not a very good book will not be trying ant of these
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super book for anyone interested in eating healthier!
customer_reviews.text: Switching over to a vegan lifestyle can be daunting... But not so much with this cookbook! Loads of truly good recipes and easy to cook food. One of my favorite cookbooks! Bought this one for my son and his wife who are trying to eat healthier than they have been!
customer_reviews.author: carla musto

customer_reviews.title: Forks Over Knives Cookbook : Very basic boring recipes for an incredible food movement.
customer_reviews.text: Forks Over Knives Cookbook : Very basic boring recipes for an incredible food movement. If you’re looking for an alternative vegetarian cookbook that’s good ‘Isa Does It’ is wayyyyyyy beyond this cookbook.
customer_reviews.author: JKN

customer_reviews.title: I love the recipes here
customer_reviews.text: I could not be more thankful for this gem! I love the recipes here, I literally make something every single day out of this book. Tonight we made the quinoa tabbouleh! It was sooooooo great and healthy. YUM!
customer_reviews.author: Diana B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Love this book. It actually has recipes I can make with normal foods at the grocery store! Not hard or complicated but so easy to switch to plant based eating along with being actually tasty! Get it!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mom of eight

customer_reviews.title: Fork it!  I'm going vegan!
customer_reviews.text: This book will get you on your way to a healthier lifestyle. I like most of the recipes, I love a few of them, there are a couple of them that I could eat every day! Lose weight, feel great, sleep better, live life happier by making and eating these options on a daily basis.
customer_reviews.author: KAWolfe

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed with the whole FOK program
customer_reviews.text: I found this cookbook after watching the Forks over Knives documentary. The film made such a huge impression on me that I decided to immediately start incorporating more plant based meals into our meal plan. Quite honestly, the film scared me, and gave me a whole new mindset about eating, and what we eat. I don't think switching to whole foods/plant based foods is an easy process, but this cookbook sure makes it a lot easier, without it I would not have really known where to start.
customer_reviews.author: L.L. Hall

customer_reviews.title: Very informative Book
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book because my grandson went vegan recently so grandma had to learn a different way of cooking for him! This book has made it easier to do that. I am learning lot from it and my grandson is enjoying grandmas cooking! lol
customer_reviews.author: Shirley S

customer_reviews.title: Great inspiration!
customer_reviews.text: I've given up animal products for a long time now so I'm used to all ingredients in the book that some may find challenging. In any case, it can be used as inspiration for a great meal as, in many case, some of the ingredients can be omitted. Just have fun with it and try them.
customer_reviews.author: M. Souza

product_meta.title: Forks Over Knives―The Cookbook: Over 300 Recipes for Plant-Based Eating All Through the Year
